Issues.Title: Fixes #3655
Issues.Body:
This is a bugfix. Issue#3655 -> Update sass/components/navbar.sass:6 The variable $navbar-height is set to 3.25rem (52px) by default. However the navbar height changes to 3.5rem (56px) as soon as a button is added! ### Proposed solution Change default navbar height from 3.25rem to 3.5rem. There is an alternate solution as well. We can reduce the default button size so that the navbar doesn't get disturbed ### Testing Done Unit testing has been done by linking my test project locally with bulma I have: 1. Cloned the bulma repo. 2. Created a new react project named PGReact. 3. Linked bulma locally with PGReact. 4. Wrote this piece of code in App.js ```
Link
Button
``` 5. Commented the code written between `
` and `
` 6. The height of navbar didn't get disturbed ### Changelog updated? No.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fixes #3655" (#3657)

Issues.Title: Navbar burger lines are weird
Issues.Body:
### Overview of the problem

Navbar burger looks weird, because the burger lines do not have the same height. Some are thinner than the others.

![image](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/assets/27026741/3fcb5a68-30c1-43de-93e9-dff7c597c280)

<!-- I'm using Bulma **version** [x.x.x] -->
Version 0.9.4.

<!-- My **browser** is: -->
Tested on Firefox and Edge.

### Expected behavior

They should all have the same height.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navbar burger lines are weird" (#3656)

Issues.Title: Navbar height should be 3.5rem by default
Issues.Body:
### Problem The variable `$navbar-height` is set to `3.25rem` (52px) by default. However the navbar height changes to `3.5rem` (56px) as soon as a button is added! ➡️ This poses a 4px problem **in the case of a fixed navbar** because the padding is calculated as follows : ```scss $navbar-height: 3.25rem !default html, body &.has-navbar-fixed-top padding-top: $navbar-height &.has-navbar-fixed-bottom padding-bottom: $navbar-height ``` #### Steps to reproduce : - Create a fixed navbar - Add buttons ```html
Link
Button
``` ### Proposed solution Change default navbar height from `3.25rem` to `3.5rem`. ```scss // sass/components/navbar.sass:6 $navbar-height: 3.5rem !default ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Navbar height should be 3.5rem by default" (#3655)

Issues.Title: Accessibility - not possible to tab into navbar dropdown
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma | the Docs**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.4
My **browser** is: Chrome
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**?

### Description

It is not possible to tab into navbar dropdown.

### Steps to Reproduce

<!--
1. Go here -> https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/#basic-navbar
2. Use tab on your keyboard to open the dropdown.
3. As you can see, that's not possible.
-->

### Expected behavior

User should be able to use their tab key to open the navbar dropdown.

### Actual behavior

It's not possible to open the navbar dropdown via a keyboard.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Accessibility - not possible to tab into navbar dropdown" (#3654)

Issues.Title: How is the main menu of bulma.io built? (QUESTION)
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma | the Docs**.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **Docs**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4] 

### Description

How is the bulma.io main menu built? This one:

![image](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/assets/26510982/8d352e28-48b7-4c29-bb0f-67cedbd98655)

It is responsive, and as the browser window size gets smaller, menu items turn into a dropdown menu behind ellipsis (three dots). 

Is this functionality available in Bulma 0.9.4? I can't find anything about it in the documentation and if this functionality is achievable, I'd appreciate a code sample! Thank you.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "How is the main menu of bulma.io built? (QUESTION)" (#3653)

Issues.Title: Docs - Left Nav collapses for widescreen for container, hero, and section topics.
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **The Docs**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

<!-- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** -->
This is about the Bulma **Docs**
<!-- I'm using Bulma **version** [x.x.x] -->
<!-- My **browser** is: -->
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
<!-- I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? -->

### Description

In the docs, the left navigation collapses and shows only dots after selecting Container, Hero, and Section. When selecting any other topics in the nav menu, the navigation becomes visible again.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. View this page:  https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/container/ or https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/hero/ or this page https://bulma.io/documentation/layout/section/.

### Expected behavior

When viewing on a desktop with ample browser width, I would expect that the left navigation remains visible and not collapsed.

### Actual behavior

The left navigation collapses when selecting Layout/Hero, Layout/Section, and Layout/Container
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Docs - Left Nav collapses for widescreen for container, hero, and section topics." (#3652)

Issues.Title: Navbar-dropdown not accounting for width of icons and is wrapping
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. It could be Bulma or me missing something in the docs. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** 0.9.4 My **browser** is: Chrome I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description If you have a navbar-dropdown which is on the right side of the page, the items wrap if they contain icons. ### Steps to Reproduce Create a navbar like this: ```
User profile
``` ### Expected behavior The dropdown should size itself to accommodate the width of the child[ ### Actual behavior It doesn't seem to account for the width of the icon and padding, instead wrapping like this: ![edit](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/330899/230225282-cfbf619d-afb8-4b6d-a74e-b62c3dd57fe0.png) If I take the icon out it works, and if I replace the text with a much longer string it works. But the inclusion of the icon makes it wrap.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Navbar-dropdown not accounting for width of icons and is wrapping" (#3635)

Issues.Title: Webpage zoomed on mobile device
Issues.Body:
I checked my website on an Android 9 mobile device and it was zoomed automatically. I tried the starter template code https://bulma.io/documentation/overview/start/
and the issue happened again.
I tried this viewport meta `<meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1, minimum-scale=1, maximum-scale=5, user-scalable=1, viewport-fit=cover">` and nothing seems to work.

Is it a bug? Thanks!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Webpage zoomed on mobile device" (#3651)

Issues.Title: card-header-title: Inline html elements "swallow" adjoining whitespace.
Issues.Body:
This is about Bulma. I believe this is a bug, but I may incorrect or it may be easier to fix as documentation. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4] My **browser** is: Google Chrome Version `113.0.5672.92 (Official Build) (arm64)` I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description When inline elements are used as direct children of a `card-header-title`, they will disrupt the inline flow of text and erase any adjoining whitespace. There are workaround, but if the behavior is expected, it could use better documentation. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Have a card with a title that includes html similar to the following: ```

Item matching search

``` 2. For example, see this [jsfiddle](https://jsfiddle.net/xwq92Lun/1/) 3. Observe the resulting whitespace ### Expected behavior There should be a single space between `Item` and `matching`: ### Actual behavior The word "Item" runs right into "matching" with no whitespace: ### Workarounds 1. One workaround is to wrap the contents of `card-header-title` in a separate element -- so that its children do not automatically become flex items. This causes extra markup, and is not mentioned anywhere in the documentation as a necessary step: ```

Item matching search

``` 2. Another workaround is to manually apply a `display: block` to `card-header-title`. e.g: ```

Item matching search

``` ### Thoughts on causes (& potential fixes) 1. This behavior occurs because of `display:flex` on `card-header title` ([link to code](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/d2d3c3dd7f2e4076b84e63efc998252851913a72/sass/components/card.sass#L49)). One way to fix it would be to simply remove that line (and also `align-items: center` which would no longer be valid. However, this would break the ability to add `.is-centered` as mentioned in the [`0.5.3` changelog](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/d2d3c3dd7f2e4076b84e63efc998252851913a72/CHANGELOG.md?plain=1#L1085). 2. If the expectation is that `card-header-title` is a _container for other elements that contain text_ and is not expected to contain text directly, the documentation should be updated to reflect this expectation. For example, the [Card component docs](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/d2d3c3dd7f2e4076b84e63efc998252851913a72/docs/cyp/components/card.html#L8) could replace their `

Card header

` example with `

Card header

` I am happy to submit a PR for either approach, but would like guidance (especially since solution # 1 would break existing functionality and need a bit more work to be less disruptive).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "card-header-title: Inline html elements "swallow" adjoining whitespace." (#3650)

Issues.Title: Select size broken without "multiple" attribute
Issues.Body:
This is a **Bulma** bug. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4] My **browser** is: Google Chrome 112.0.5615.138 I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? I've tried searching, and didn't find a duplicate, maybe I missed it. ### Description Size attribute on a select element doesn't show multiple options, and doesn't hide the "V" icon. ### Steps to Reproduce With Bulma loaded, add this code to the HTML page: ```html
``` ### Expected behavior The select should show 3 options, same as without Bulma. It should show up as when using the "Multiple select" (from the documentation), but without the ability to select multiple options. ### Actual behavior It showed 1 option, with the "V" icon, and the scrollbar, with the second option slightly visible. It might have changed some dimensions too, not sure. Adding the "is-multiple" class to the div element removed the "V" icon. Adding the unwanted "multiple" attribute to the select tag fixes the display issues, but then the user is able to select multiple things.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Select size broken without "multiple" attribute" (#3647)

Issues.Title: [Feature Request] Support for the `<dialog/>` HTML element
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4]
My **browser** is: Google Chrome
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
<!-- I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? -->

### Description

<!-- Description of the bug, enhancement, or question -->

I'm discovering the `<dialog/>` HTML element (see [specification](https://developer.mozilla.org/fr/docs/Web/HTML/Element/dialog)).

It would be nice if Bulma could provide a default styling so that we can use it with the modal component:

```html
<dialog class="modal" id="mymodal">
  ...
</dialog>
```

```javascript
const dialog = document.getElementById('mymodal');
dialog.showModal();
// ...
dialog.close();
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Feature Request] Support for the `<dialog/>` HTML element" (#3646)

Issues.Title: feat: improve rtl support
Issues.Body:
This is an **improvement** of the RTL support to fit with html `dir` attribute.

```html
<html dir="rtl">
  <!-- ... -->
</html>
```

### Proposed solution

Using logical properties in place of `ltr-property`/`ltr-position` sass mixin allow having only one stylesheet for both LTR and RTL, reducing impact for websites with multiple languages.



### Tradeoffs

The `$rtl` variable and `ltr-property`/`ltr-position` mixin are removed, that may be a breaking change for downstream projects

### Testing Done

Using pnpm overrides on projects:

```json
{
  "pnpm": {
    "overrides": {
      "bulma": "npm:@cssninja/bulma@0.9.4"
    }
  }
}
```

https://www.npmjs.com/package/@cssninja/bulma

### Changelog updated?

No.

<!-- Thanks! -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat: improve rtl support" (#3643)

Issues.Title: add: cursor: pointer on <label for="">
Issues.Body:
Makes use of “cursor: pointer”, when a label is bound to a form element.

<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a ** improvement**.
<!-- New feature? Update the CHANGELOG.md too, and eventually the Docs. -->
<!-- Improvement? Explain how and why. -->
Labels, wich are bound like `<label for="formElement">Your Label</label>` should have a pointer as a cursor, as long they are clickable.
<!-- Bugfix? Reference that issue as well. -->

### Proposed solution

<!-- Which specific problem does this PR solve and how?  -->
<!-- If it fixes a particular Issue, add "Fixes #ISSUE_NUMBER" in your title -->
The solution: just add `cursor: pointer;`, when there is a `for=""` attribute.

### Tradeoffs

<!-- What are the drawbacks of this solution? Are there alternative ones? -->
<!-- Think of performance, build time, usability, complexity, coupling…) -->
There shouldn't be any tradeoffs, in my opinion.

### Testing Done

None.

<!-- BEFORE SUBMITTING YOUR PR, MAKE SURE TO FOLLOW THESE STEPS: -->
<!-- 1. Pull the latest `master` branch -->
<!-- 2. Make sure your Sass code is compliant with the [Bulma Sass styleguide](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#bulma-sass-styleguide) -->
<!-- 3. Make sure your PR only affects `.sass` or documentation files -->
<!-- 4. [Try your changes](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#try-your-changes). -->

<!-- How have you confirmed this feature works? -->
<!-- Please explain more than "Yes". -->
Yes, on hover it displays me the pointer-cursor.

[screen-capture.webm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/68828301/235317262-63414914-d254-40bd-98f8-d3e863605723.webm)

### Changelog updated?

No.


<!-- Thanks! -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "add: cursor: pointer on <label for="">" (#3642)

Issues.Title: Replace custom divide function with sass built-in math.div.
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is an **improvement**.
<!-- New feature? Update the CHANGELOG.md too, and eventually the Docs. -->
<!-- Improvement? Explain how and why. -->
<!-- Bugfix? Reference that issue as well. -->

### Proposed solution

Currently, bulma uses a custom implemented `divide` function in multiple functions. The main downside of using this custom division function, is that it uses multiple loops that severely slow down build speeds on the final app.

This has been reported previously at #3604, and was been investigated in a separate thread.

This pull request replaces the custom `divide` function logic with the built-in sass `math.div` function. This change results in 20x quicker build times with nuxt + vite.

### Tradeoffs

Because node-sass has not been updated, there is no support for the `math.div` function. To work around this issue, I've replaced all references with `node-sass` to the `sass` npm package. The functionality is nearly identical, and there should be no modification necessary to any workflows.

### Testing Done

I have built both the main `css` files along with the `rtl-css` files. Both returned perfect results, and no errors were displayed during building.

### Changelog updated?

No.

<!-- Thanks! -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Replace custom divide function with sass built-in math.div." (#3641)

Issues.Title: Bump yaml from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2 in /docs
Issues.Body:
Bumps [yaml](https://github.com/eemeli/yaml) from 2.2.1 to 2.2.2.
Release notes

Sourced from yaml's releases.

v2.2.2

This patch release includes a fix for an error that could be thrown in parseDocument for degenerate input. Otherwise, it's a patch release uplifting a few fixes from the ongoing v2.3 work to v2.2:

  • Corner case failure in error pretty-printer (CVE-2023-2251)
  • Use correct argument order when stringifying flow collection comments (#443)
  • First-line folding for block scalars (#422)
Commits
  • f21fa45 2.2.2
  • 984f578 fix: Corner case failure in error pretty-printer
  • 443e3aa fix: First-line folding for block scalars (fixes #422)
  • 5af5d3d fix: Use correct argument order when stringifying flow collection comments (f...
  • See full diff in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=yaml&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=2.2.1&new-version=2.2.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/network/alerts).

Issues.Title: Button with "is-loading" modifier, the loading spinner is not visible if used with "is-inverted" modifier
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** [latest on live bulma.com site by the time issue was created]
My **browser** is: Chrome v112
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**?: Yes I'm sure

### Description

If the button is used with the "is-loading" modifier, the loading spinner becomes practically invisible if used with the "is-inverted" modifier

### Steps to Reproduce

1. go to the buttons states loading section of the Bulma webpage https://bulma.io/documentation/elements/button/#states
2. open the dev-tools from the browser.
3. inspect the button that has the is-primary CSS class.
4. add to the selected button the is-inverted CSS class.

### Expected behavior

The expected behavior should be that the loading spinner takes the inverted color of the main color class if set ex: "is-primary" or the default color for text.

### Actual behavior

it just displays a blank button
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Button with "is-loading" modifier, the loading spinner is not visible if used with "is-inverted" modifier" (#3637)

Issues.Title: Button too large inside <details> element.
Issues.Body:
Hi, first of all thanks for your great work on bulma! I ran into an issue placing buttons inside a `
` element. ### Description Buttons inside the `
` element appear too big in comparison when placed outside of that element, see: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14072500/230304451-a306ae21-4d50-4559-be4c-12b7beb3f1af.png) Tested with latest Bulma version (v0.9.4) under Firefox and Chrome. Seems to be related to: https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/issues/1696 ### Steps to Reproduce To reproduce, check out the code below or this codepen: https://codepen.io/strfx/pen/MWPWbvY The first button appears regularly sized, the button inside `
` is too big. ```html
I am regularly sized
I am too big
``` ### Workaround Adding `box-sizing: border-box;` to the element fixes the buttons' heights (from https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/issues/1696#issuecomment-402984993). ```css details .button { box-sizing: border-box; } ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Button too large inside <details> element." (#3636)

Issues.Title: Improve text weight typography helpers docs display
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **documentation fix**.
<!-- New feature? Update the CHANGELOG.md too, and eventually the Docs. -->
<!-- Improvement? Explain how and why. -->
<!-- Bugfix? Reference that issue as well. -->
When using the helpers I wasn't sure which one I wanted because they were all just wrapped in `strong`.
Instead I think it would be nice for folks to be able to see the difference in text weight in the docs and see the helper applied in action.

### Proposed solution

<!-- Which specific problem does this PR solve and how?  -->
<!-- If it fixes a particular Issue, add "Fixes #ISSUE_NUMBER" in your title -->
Make the weight name match the weight helper it's aligned with.

![CleanShot 2023-03-16 at 11 53 17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/85516727/225724067-3d1ed5d6-d414-4a4a-94f9-2dcda6fa6974.png)

### Tradeoffs
Could possible affect readability.

### Changelog updated?

No.

Issues.Title: Ordering of 'Backers' page
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **the Docs**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

<!-- This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** -->
This is about the Bulma **Docs**
<!-- I'm using Bulma **version** [x.x.x] -->
<!-- My **browser** is: -->
<!-- This is a **Sass** issue: I'm using version [x.x.x] -->
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**

### Description

<!-- Description of the bug, enhancement, or question -->

The [Backers page](https://bulma.io/backers/) is ordered as follows:
- Generous backers ($30+)
- Documentation sponsors ($500+)
- Website sponsors ($300+)
- Homepage sponsors ($100+)
- Bulma backers ($10+)

It seems to me that the 'Generous backers' section should be bumped down to sit between 'Homepage sponsors' and 'Bulma backers'. That way everything would be ordered in descending order by amount donated.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Ordering of 'Backers' page" (#3631)

Issues.Title: Text in narrow column overflows, do not line-break
Issues.Body:
This is about a **bug or feature**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.9.4] My **browser** is: firefox ### Description When a column is-narrow the text that contains do not line-break. What I want to do is to use `is-narrow` in a text column. But when screen become too narrow it overflows instead of applying line-break. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Paste the body code bellow in html file with bulma framework. 2. Open your browser and resize the screen. ```

Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.

``` ### Expected behavior When screen is too narrow the narrow column with text should line-break. ### Actual behavior When screen is too narrow the narrow column with text overflows. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/80093501/225265575-475be469-381a-400c-abdd-14fdc08e9f87.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Text in narrow column overflows, do not line-break" (#3630)

Issues.Title: Update navbar docs
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **documentation fix**.

for browser accessibility support the hamburger menu should be a button. An anchor is for navigation, a button is for an action like a toggle. Semantic HTML should be used whenever possible.

### Proposed solution
Currently the hamburger menu shows an anchor tag for the button which does not allow for it to be focusable out of the box. It should be a button tag because it's performing an action and not navigating the user to a new page.
You can read more about the difference between anchor tags and buttons [here](https://www.digitala11y.com/links-vs-buttons-a-perennial-problem/)

### Tradeoffs

<!-- What are the drawbacks of this solution? Are there alternative ones? -->
<!-- Think of performance, build time, usability, complexity, coupling…) -->

### Testing Done

None.

<!-- BEFORE SUBMITTING YOUR PR, MAKE SURE TO FOLLOW THESE STEPS: -->
<!-- 1. Pull the latest `master` branch -->
<!-- 2. Make sure your Sass code is compliant with the [Bulma Sass styleguide](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#bulma-sass-styleguide) -->
<!-- 3. Make sure your PR only affects `.sass` or documentation files -->
<!-- 4. [Try your changes](https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#try-your-changes). -->

<!-- How have you confirmed this feature works? -->
<!-- Please explain more than "Yes". -->

No.

<!-- Thanks! -->
